result.execSummary:
The defendant Cole W. Karnitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit of 1 day if revoked
Concurrent with: with 14CF195 & 15CF3

miscConds.notes:
AODA
No consumption of alcohol
Counseling

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cole W. Karnitz

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cole W. Karnitz in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CT18, 14CF195, 15Cf3, 15CF16 and 15CF47.  Court will address 15CF47 - Review right to preliminary hearing.  Def waives right to preliminary.  Court will accept waiver.  Court finds probable cause.   Statement of Negotiated plea filed   Def has reviewed.  State has reviewed and agrees.  14CT18  Ct 1 Guilty plea.  Ct 2 dismissed(and read in per plea agreement )  14CF195  Ct 1 OWI 4th.  Def acknowledges previous convictions.   Guilty plea entered.  Ct 3 - Guilty plea.  Ct 4 - Guilty plea.  Ct 2 & 5 Dismissed and read in.  15CF3 - Ct 1 amended to OWI 5th since def enter plea in 14CF195.  Amended Information filed.  Ct 1 guilty plea entered.  Ct 2 - Guilty plea enter.  Ct 3,4 & 5 Dismissed and read in.  15CF16  Ct 1 Guilty plea  Ct 2 dismissed and read in.  15CF47  Ct 1 - guilty plea   Ct 2 & 3 dismissed and read in.   Plea questionnaire reviewed.  Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  14CF195 BAC  .134.   15CF3 BAC .142.   Factual basis for pleas.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Court will accept pleas, found guilty.  Nothing by def.  Court will accept plea agreement.  14CT18 Fine 150 plus cost.  Included $200 DNA surcharge.  14CF195 Ct 1 Probation 3 yrs. AODA,   Fine $2542.  6 months jail. 2 yrs revocation.  1 yr IID effective upon application  Jail to commence today.  Huber privileges.  Ct 3 Fine 150. plus cost, included $200 DNA sur.  Ct 4 Probation 2 yrs  Jail 20 days consecutive to ct 1 Counseling and court cost.  2 days jail cr if revoked.  15CF3 - Ct 1 3 yrs probation.  AODA assessement.  $2542.00 fine & cost.  1 yr jail, consecutive to 14CF195, 3 yrs revocation.  1 yr IID   Ct 2 3 yrs probation  AODA assessment and cost.  Credit of 2 days if revoked.  Probation to run concurrent.  15CF16 Ct 1 - 4 yrs prison 2 yrs  initial conf. & 2 yrs extended supervision  consecutive to other sentences.  Stayed 3 yrs probation.  AODA no use of alcohol  Counseling and cost.  Def is eligible for earn released and abuse program  15CF47 Ct 1  3 yrs probation  AODA no alchol. counseling court ocst.  2 days cr. if revoked.  15CF16 1 day cr if revoked.  Felony conviction, voting and firearms restriction.  DNA sample.  Request bonds be retuned.  Payment plan  Court will order bonds to be returned to posters  Post conviction rights.  Request huber for AODA appointments.  Court will not object to huber for AODA appointments if approved by jail.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.   Cases with probation, sentences withheld.

Defendant Cole W. Karnitz in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF3, 15CF16, 14CT18 and 14CF195 @ 2:32 p.m. Def will waive prelim hrgs for all three felony files, set all 4 cases for plea/sentencing. 14CF195 - Court reviews prelim waiver. Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds over. 15CF3 - Court reviews prelim waiver. Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds over. 15CF16 - Court reviews prelim waiver. Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds over.  Informations filed. Copies received, reading waived. Not guilty pleas to all counts in all cases. Court enters not guilty pleas. Bond forf hrgs will remain as scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
